active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student teaches the other about Key Risk Indicators (KRIs), Standardized Information Gathering (SIG) questionnaires, and maturity models for TPRM evaluation; switch roles and provide feedback on accuracy and clarity.
active_learning.problem_solving: Analyze a mock vendor dossier (e.g., includes ISO 27001 certification but Log4j exposure history). Teams assess risk posture using NIST guidelines, recommend mitigations, and present findings in a 5-minute pitch.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Third-Party Risk Management Program Evaluation (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Acquired Software Security Assessment > 002_Vendor and Supplier Evaluation > Vendor Security Posture Assessment > Third-Party 002_Risk Management Program Evaluation). Generate 25 high-quality Anki-compatible flashcards optimized for university-level learning. Integrate: - Learning objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] (reference in explanations) - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL LAYERS FROM ABOVE] (tag each card to 1 layer) - Research context: TPRM definitions, NIST CSF 2.0, SP 800-161, ISO 27001/27036, SIG questionnaires, KRIs, maturity models, cases (SolarWinds, Log4j). - Best practices: Step-by-step evaluation, vendor assessments. Follow flashcard schema exactly: [INSERT FULL SCHEMA FROM ABOVE]. Output as JSON array of objects, e.g., [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'references': '...', 'related_activity': '...'}, 'metadata': {...}}]. Ensure Bloom's progression, distractor quality, and scaffolding flow. Cards must foster active learning (e.g., 'How would you apply this in a peer teach?'). No duplicates; cover all objectives.
